name: Jessica
text: My friends love living here...

name: camryn jewell
text: DO NOT LIVE HERE!!! I am currently 7 months into the lease and I CANNOT wait to move out. This place is NOISYY!! if you like a peace of mind DO NOT live here. I’m downstairs and can hear the upstairs peoples convos, stomping(so loud), their tv, any music, them doing the deed literally freaking anything they do I can hear. It’s making me lose my mind. I hate it here soooooo much

name: Taylor Blakely
text: It's a nice complex. Maintenance works really fast and are super nice! One of the really friendly maintenance men saw me struggling with fixing my bike and actually fixed it for me! The place is always very clean as well. My only complain would be that the walls are so thin in the apartments you can hear everything but for the price we pay I don't plan on moving anytime soon!

name: Nicole Parker
text: I rented here and broke my lease which they are suing me for and during my stay my house was broken into twice I reported it to the authorities and  had to pay for adt home security I also had my entire apartment flood with sewer water from a back up in the septic system it ruined literally everything downstairs 3 times causing several thousands of dollars worth of damage and calling the maintenance man was a joke no one came it was horrific don’t move here

name: Amy Tadlock
text: I lived here for 10 years. Before it was sold and remodeled. At first it was wonderful, but then the rent kept going up, and the neighborhood kept going down. The tennis court wasn't kept up and the pools and park were staying dirty. I've been back after I moved, and it has improved some with new management.

name: Ryan Rossi
text: Great experience working with the friendly staff.

name: vijay orugu
text: It's quite almost every time.cheap and best.the only problem is with there management they were so rude there will be old lady in the front desk she working from 8 years doesn't have minimum courtesy to people

name: Lifes Great
text: Well I've lived there for two years and I only have 1 problem they don't spray for roches that often and it's weird

name: Allison Stephens
text: I am about to move in here. The apartments seem very nice. Management has been nothing but nice to me. Was able to get a 3 bedroom in about 3 months after applying when everyone else said I could be on a waiting list for a year or more. Rent is cheaper here than anywhere else I found. Thankful to have been able to rent from here so fast!

name: Jake Helton
text: The maintenance is top notch! 😁

name: Rose Guillaume
text: I really love leaving there Amanda brown the manager she was so amazing

name: Emily Stevens
text: I currently live here. I personally think that the manager is AWESOME! She is funny, kind and caring. She works with you when you need it. There are rules here and they are enforced which makes sure all tenants are safe and the property is kept like it's supposed to, rules are a good thing and I'm glad they are in place! The few times we have had maintenance issues, they are addressed and fixed within the week or so. Which is pretty impeccable considering there is so many apartments/buildings here for them to keep up with. Pest control is here every month, we do not have any bug problems. I'm very happy with the management, maintenance, and everything else that comes with living here.

name: Cori Bradley
text: Paid application fee, get told I'm approved. I've been called with the same questions over and over again just to be told to they will call me the same day and never do. They did this over and over until one day they just stopped calling. The fee is clearly nonrefundable, and I'm out $50 because I  had to pay per adult accordig to them. And after a month and a half of trying and calling, no one responds or attempts to call back. I've never had this much trouble trying to rent.

name: David Anderson
text: There’s new management and maintenance now.

name: Eric McMunn
text: Management is extremely rude to tennants and guests, appliances are not kept in working order, and there are serious trip hazards in the "handicap accessible" sidewalks. Hvac is not kept in operating order and filters are not changed regularly.

name: Art Of Valor
text: The manager is very hateful. She is a pain to have to deal with. Very miserable experience here because of this woman. Could be a very nice place if different management took over.

name: Enrique Cruz
text: Quiet and friendly

name: Virginia Barck
text: Good

name: Adonai Rezene
text: it is awsome

name: Sandra Davis
text: Cordova Parks Apartments is a senior citizens community. The apartments are easy to maintain inside. There's no carpets to vacuum and the layout is simple and easy to navigate with a walker or wheelchair. The only problem that I see with the apartment is a wheelchair will not go through the bathroom door. This is very important if the occupant cannot walk at all. The grounds are well kept, and the office staff are very accommodating. They will do well checks on residents if you can't get in touch with them.

name: Cindy Dickerson
text: My best friend's parents moved here and I was pleasantly surprised with how clean amd well manicured everything really was.

name: Cindy Lou
text: Very nice apartments and very nice neighborhood quite and pleasant I just love them and my neighbors also

name: Marlon Vines
text: The complex is neat and clean & the neighborhood is safe. This place is a destination, not a drive by with traffic .

name: Barbra Godsey
text: It is a seniors' citizen and disabled persons living facility. Very quiet and peaceful neighborhood, everyone gets along and keeps to them selves. Helps each other if we can.

name: Kadie Oquain
text: Going cheap apartments Great location friendly neighborhood

name: Dennis Lane
text: Everyone try to CK on someone else's, the management is very caring and loving N helpful

name: Marsha Edwards
text: They should let people with records rent apartments, because sometimes people are just in the wrong place at the wrong time. Their not bad people. And people do change. And that's for anywhere where someone needs a place to live.

name: Marshall Pratt
text: This place is horribly ran down

name: SARAH DOWNS
text: They r a respectable place

name: Sallie Foster
text: They evicted my disabled friend.

name: Cassie jo Busby
text: Great place to live.

name: Marsha Edwards
text: Nice place to live

name: Tracie Kinder
text: Managed well, clean environment.

name: Lemuel Hill
text: I wish I could stay there

name: Demetrice Johnson
text: This was the worst living experience I have ever had, I don't and won't wish this on any body. The worst place ever.

name: EPICSHE
text: I had lived here for two years and management sucks! My air conditioner has been out since last summer. The old manager she was so nasty. It is currently undet new management Tmi real estate and no improvement yet. The apartments are gross with pest. Most apartments you share a small front porch with neighbor.  Also, not a safe area gun fire is random.

name: Wesley Watts
text: CLOSE TO DOWNTOWN

name: Derek Pettaway
text: Great place to live

name: Connie Perlander
text: Love History

name: Betty Nestle
text: Love

name: Shaneka Mcbryde
text: I have been here only 2 months and when I moved in, I REPORTED that the tub was dirty...  I informed management about it and nothing was done!!!

name: Bhargav Prasad Reddy
text:
The lady(Arizvett) is so friendly and good at convincing the people.
Also, People can even take counseling classes from her....😆😆

name: Donnie Brown
text: Donnie Brown lam very pleased to be here: the staff is wonderful and very cooperative; here we are one big Happy family!!!

name: Eileen Kiser
text:
Dependable maintenance in general, relatively quiet and I always felt safe.
Continuation of original review:
I have had several instances I called on maintenance and they were there quick as can be, I can say they take good care of their residents.

name: Jackie Morgan
text: I am very satisfied with the staff and maintenance crew. If I have any problems maintenance answers them quickly and professionally. You couldn't ask for better staff members. They are always courteous and go to great lengths to assist you with a resolution to whatever problem you have. Coudouz to Mr.Billy and Mrs.Anita. I love them like family, always willing to help. I have no problems with the maintenance crew either.  The only complaint I have is no dish washer,and no washer dryer connection and I hate the carpet. These things are beyond their control. I am pretty sure they would rectify this if they had attonimy to do so. I really don't like washing my clothes behind others. This is the first apartment I've had with no washer dryer hook up. Oh, back to things I like pest control monthly. I also like the vanity on the outside. It allows others to use the bathroom while you wash your hands.

name: Stephanie Hale
text: Don't stay here . the break in cars people out here is weird looking . look like all them stay in a mental home.  Its ghetto and the apartments smell the have bed bugs . they don't care about nothing its not safe you should just stay in Gibbs villages its safer.

name: Orantheous Perdue
text:
If I could give this place a zero star I would.
The maintenance men are trash and the property manager is even more trash.
Rude. Petty. Thieves. The maintenance men has stolen lots of things from me and I know they did it because I know what I all I had.
All of the sudden I longer have my things that i bought. I just wish there was a way for me to prove it. But they come into your apartment when you arent home and they ramble and steal your personal belongings. Also as far as the apartment itself goes. I would never suggest anyone to come to this place. The apartment is not worth the amount of money they are asking for. It does not have stainless steal. It does not have 2 bathrooms. It does not have a dishwasher. It does not have washer or dryer hookups. No ceiling fans.
No fireplace. No 24 hour surveillance.  No 24 hour on duty police. All you get for your 700 bucks a month is an apartment that comes with carpet, air and heat, and a garbage disposal. I took this apartment when it was WARREN HOUSE. Before all of the price increases and before all of these thieves.
Be careful of your car. They do break into them.

name: Renay Lucas
text: My family and I moved here from Niagara Falls New York. I love my apartment and the staff is very nice.

name: Kimberly Williams
text: I have been having serious issues with a person that lives next door tome with a dog that weights almost seventy pounds that uses the bathroom by my door tried to bite my grandson and tried to bite me lady Monday. I have made complaints after complaints and nothing has been done. They leave home the dog cries and make all kind of noises. I am righting this post for a reason.

name: Melissa Green
text:
The inside of the apartments are clean, good air and heat, garbage disposal, some are furnished and some are not. The management team is really on the up and up to respond to any and all complaints if there are any about the apartment. The grass is always cut. As a matter of fact the grass is cut too much.almost every other day even if it rains. The pest control is here every single month like clockwork. The neighbors depending where you are some are actually nice. Others are just plain long nosey! Then there are some that will get angry if you appear to not want to be their friend. If you live downstairs your neighbor upstairs is not considerate of you living below them. So yeah they like to stomp their feet as hard as they can when they are walking across the floor. My best advice: always get an upstairs place.
There have been a number of car break ins.
And there isnt a 24 hour security guard patroling the property. I personally have never had a problem. But I have seen others who have. My best advice is: JUST DONT LEAVE YOUR VALUABLES IN YOUR CAR. AND DONT
ADVERTISE YOUR BOOMING CAR RADIO,YOUR SUPER PAINT JOB, YOUR TV IN YOUR CAR, OR YOUR NICE SHINNY RIMS ON YOUR TIRES.
Dont walk around with a gang load of jewelry on your neck and 200 dollar shoes. Etc..etc.
And things like robery possibly could be prevented. Overall this apartment complex is not bad. Its pretty decent for the price. The only complaint that I have is its this filthy nasty looking Maintence guy that's always wearing the same old dusty looking clothes all day everyday. I DONT THINK THE GUY EVEN KNOWS WHAT A WASHING MACHINE OR BATH TUB EVEN IS!  He is so gross he reminds me of the tv show called Swamp Thing!
I hate when that guy comes to my apartment to fix anything. I try to fix it or get it repaired myself so i dont have his gross ass walking around in my place.
I hate that there is only one pool open. But other thsn that. I would give this place 3 stars.

name: trealetic mind
text:
its a alright place to live if you"re just getting started or starting over.  but i think somebody made an unauthorised visit into my apartment in middle of the night one night while i was sleeping.
i kept hearing the door locks turn real slow.but i was asleep so i"m not very sure if i dreamed it or not. but since then i haven"t been all that comfortable about staying here. the people who live here act like they will have a hissy fit if you don"t want to be friends with them.they purposely make excuses to be in the exact same place you are at the exact same time every single time just so they can be in your face to see if you are going to speak or hold some type of conversation.  i dont want to make friends, and i dont want to be doing anyone any favors, i just want to live in my apartment and not be bothered by anybody. DAM is that really too much to ask?

name: BYRDIE Yeah
text: Since the new take over I have to come in and change my review. At one point I had no complaints about living here. But since this new take over I have to report that I am not pleased. The rent use to be 650 or month for a basic 2 bed 1 bath unfurnished  apartment. But now the rent is you can go ahead and say 700 a month for a basic 2 bed 1 bath unfurnished  apartment that comes with only a garbage disposal and carpet on the floor and central heat and air(in which all apartments are suppose to come with air and heat so that's no spotlight). Thats right only 1 bath for 700 and no ceiling fans. No washer or dryer hook ups. I have to walk to the washroom to wash my clothes and pay to use the machines. And even though I pay to use the machines as well as I pay my rent. There is this huge big red sign on the wall in the washroom that says NO LOITERING AND WE ARE NOT RESPONSIBLE  FOR LOST STOLEN PR DAMAGED ITEMS....sounds like a set up huh....you can't stand around and watch your clothes not can you complain if something happens to them....my clothes was both ripped and stolen from using that washroom....so now I never use it at all.....No dishwasher. No ice maker in the apartment period. The sink sits outside of the bathroom instead of actually in the bathroom where its suppose to be. There is this itty bitty small so called balcony just outside of the master bedroom. The so called code gate barely works..they are always fixing on it. And if it does work then it only stops cars from coming in at night. It does not stop people from walking in on foot. There has been a number of car break ins. And nothing has been done about it. There is no security guard or police patrolling the area around the clock for safety at all. Only 1 cop will show up every blue moon from mpd ride through and keep going. He doesn't stay posted on this site at all. There is this guy that's in maintenance that looks like a child molester. Neighbors are ok. Some are nice others are nosey. There is this one real old dude that loves to scream at the top of his lungs just to hold a conversation with another person. That gets really annoying especially  when you work at night and are trying to get some sleep. The people in the rent office some are ok. But then again there is always one who thinks that they are the owner of the place and they are the one whose calling shots and running the show. And sometimes I have to let them know that I am the one who pays rent. That means that I am the customer and you serve me not the other way around. Sometimes you have to remind peggy that she is an employee at this apartment complex. She gets paid to do a job. She is not doing anyone any favors. Nor does anyone owe her behind explanations or anything else that they choose to do. At one point like I said I use to love being here. And obviously there were others who did as well because it has been several people that have lived here for over 6 years. But now those people are moving out. And I dont blame them. The only reason why i choose to stay is because it seems to be the only place in town to live that allows you to be on a month to month program. Which means you are not stuck here until your lease is up. You can leave whenever you want. Just as long as you give a 30 day notice. At one point a studio would go for roughly around 400 bucks. But now it's like 528. I saw on the available list that they had an apartment that's going for 748 with contract and like 900 without contract(lease) 900? And no washer dryer hookups. No dishwasher. No microwave. No ceiling fans. No ice maker. No stainless steel. Only 1 bathroom. No fitness center. No security patrolling the area around the clock. No video surveillance.  I can do so much better at Vaughn lakes. Not only are there prices cheaper. But the area and the apartment is worth anyone's time. They have fireplaces in their apartments. Burglar alarms in the apartments. Video survallence all over the property. Fishing ponds. Fitness center. 24 hour pool. Washer and dryer hookups. As well as a washroom that's open 24 hours a day.

name: sherell gray
text:
Since ive been here i have experienced quietness. Nobody bothers me at all. But then agin i never fool with people anyway. so why should they bother me? But on the other hand
The apartment complex itself could stand for a makeover. Yes a new color of paint on the building and the stairs wouldnt hurt at all. The inside of the apartment is very clean and well maintained. Pest control every month. THATS A PLUS!!!! Garbage disposal.
Decent applicances. Beautiful hardwood floors!
Im not too fun of the sink that sits just outside of the bathroom. Im use to a sink being inside the bathroom with the toilet and the tub. But hey thats ok too. It'll work. I dont like the fact that the pool stays closed more than it does open. And i dont like the washroom. Its entirely too small and too closed in. Its only one exit and thats threw the door that you came in. So far i havent had any problems but i fear that washroom! It scares the hell out of me! And i feel that if its going to be that small and that closed in then it should have round the clock monitoring or a security camera. Or at least extent the size of it so that it would not only offer more washers and dryers but also a second way out as a safety concern for the residents Espically females. I love the bbq grills all over the property.THATS A PLUS! And i truly enjoy lots snd lots of shade in the summer. Thats also a plus! I love the central air/heat. Thats a plus. I love the fact that everything you need is not far away. Theres resturants, grocery store, dollar stores, places for entertainment such as bowling etc.gas station. Everything is right at your fingertips.
And its quiet! I like it here. Its pretty decent.

name: Steve Michaels
text: Clean, safe, affordable and great service!

name: Ava Bolden
text: Apartments visual outside is great but inside is a no

name: Carpenter Pros
text: Good reasonable price good

name: Alexandria Stones
text: If you have kids and not in your late fifty's do not  move here it's really for senior citizens the property manager seems to hate kids alone with the senior citizens well not all of em any lil thing you do will get you eviction no chance of being a child here or having one no playground no talking unless whisper you have to be very quiet cuse the old folks will make a scene like you screaming but hi old folks caught in 0lllllllllll ways old and restless that's why they have senior citizens places for them they be coming and going and act grumpy and C- nile it's really no much of freedom here certain parts if you don't stay there they have some to say about you walking by it's a very messy overrated dramatic mess here . Treat you like prisoners

resp.text:
Hello Ms. Stones,

Bay Oaks Apartments is not a 55 and older community. Our community has 1, 2 and even 3 bedroom apartments that can  accommodate those who are under the age of 55.

You are right, at the present time, we do not have a playground. Just recently the community has started renovation and the plan is to install something for the children. Apartment living can be a challenge for children as well as adults.  It's not like having your own place and doing whatever you want to do.  While living in an apartment, everyone has to be considerate and mindful of those who live above, below and around them.  Our motto is be a "Good Neighbor".

I have an open door policy for our residents and if there is a concern residents are more than welcome to come speak with me.
If you are a resident, please come see me so that we can address your concern.

name: Fortnite master
text: I gave it five stars because I like it when I first saw it!!!!

resp.text: Thank you very much for giving us a 5 star.  We are doing some awesome renovations to the interior and exterior buildings.  Stop by when you get a chance and see the recent renovations.

name: iceman Don
text: Is. A. Luxurious. Beautiful. Place. To. Live

name: Jody Mclean
text: Nice friendly people live there but bad neighborhood and the management is horrific

resp.text:
Sorry to hear that you did not like previous management. I am the new Property Manager and truly take pride in serving my residents.  I wish you would be here now because you would see a change that is taking place.  My loyalty is to the residents and to do everything I can do to make this place a place they love to call home. I am holding maintenance accountable and following up on work orders.
Bay Oaks is a lovely place.

name: Latasha Thompson
text: It has great people living there

name: Erika Nettles
text: Nice area and section 8 housing

name: Lena Kidd
text: Love it

resp.text: Ms. Kidd, thank you very much for taking the time to give us a great review.  We have been working extremely hard to make improvements to Bay Oaks and take pride in all the recent renovations that have been completed so far.

name: Chosen 9_
text: Fun place

resp.text: We are happy to read your post that Bay Oaks is a fun place.  Just recently we have completed some renovation on 1 of the building exterior.  We have 5 more to go... Stop by to see what all the buzz is about . We love our residents and want them to love their new home.

name: alventa robinson
text: Not real good

name: Charla Gresham
text: My siblings

name: Marcus Richardson
text: Shady spot

name: Dats Weezy
text: It's a good environment

name: Bryan Breland
text: Clean wellanicured landscaping

name: Twinkle Davis
text: Quiet at times.

name: Joseph Mclean
text: Bad neighborhood.  Bad management

resp.text: I am sorry to hear that you were displeased.  I am the new Property Manager  now at Bay Oaks and am striving to make things right. We recently started renovations. I take pride in my work and truly love what I do and that is to serve the residents.

name: Charles Rudolph
text: Need light in parking lots

resp.text: Thank you for your post. We are working on getting new lighting through out the community.

name: Taylor Bench
text: almost

name: Amanda Bouie
text: No comment

name: Brooks Cade
text: Shootings

name: Melissa Harris
text: Best multifamily company..very friendly and loyal to their employees..promote within and have a wonderful and very experienced Regional Vice President..Katie Tillman will help with all your needs
